<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 18"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Improbable Elixirs](/Feats.aspx?ID=5800) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemist" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=812" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 69 <sup>1.1</sup>

</column>

---

Your mastery of alchemical secrets enables you to replicate effects most believe can be achieved only via magic. Select a number of [potions](/Traits.aspx?ID=672) equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1); these potions must be of 9th level or lower. You gain formulas to create these potions as alchemical consumables with the [elixir](/Traits.aspx?ID=589) trait. When making these alchemical elixirs, you can substitute alchemical reagents for an equal value of magical components, and you can use an [alchemist's toolkit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2702) (for [Quick Alchemy](/Actions.aspx?ID=2801)) or an [alchemist's lab](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2701) (for the [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=2385) activity) instead of any other required toolkits. Other than that, the formula doesn't change. Once you've chosen the potion formulas, they can't be changed.
name: Improbable Elixirs
